solution_line_template: If the road has four lanes and {trucks_per_lane} trucks in each lane, the total number of trucks in all the lanes is {trucks_per_lane}*{num_lanes} = <<{num_lanes}*{trucks_per_lane}={total_trucks}>>{total_trucks}.
Since in each lane the number of cars is twice as many as the number of trucks in all the lanes, there are {multiplier_cars}*{total_trucks}={cars_per_lane} cars in each lane.
The total number of cars in all the lanes is {cars_per_lane}*{num_lanes} = <<{cars_per_lane}*{num_lanes}={total_cars}>>{total_cars}
In all the lanes, the total number of vehicles is {total_trucks} trucks+{total_cars} cars = <<{total_trucks}+{total_cars}={total_vehicles}>>{total_vehicles}
